fields.description:
When I edit a filter, sometimes I can sort on up to three columns:
Sorted by: Status ascending, then Resolution ascending, then Updated descending 

Sometimes I can only sort on two (e.g. the third sort knocks of the second).

And sometimes "Key descending" insists on being the third sort, thus my third sort knocks out the second.

The help does not seem to say how many columns it should be possble to sort on, or what the rules are.

fields.description:
1) I had a group with the following rights:
   - Browse project
   - Create Issue
   - Add comment
   - Create attachment

2) For an administration reason I created a new group with exactly the same rights

3) I swapped some users from the first group to the second one

===> Now, the users from the second group are not able to connect to JIRA anymore.
     If I swap them again to the first group, it works !!

Please help, I need to give a training to end-users next Monday (14th of February)


Fabiano Gaiga
Test Manager at European Parliament

fields.description:
The appearance of the roadmap-panel.vm panel has changed from version 2.6. The text on this panel used to be left aligned and now it is centered. It is much easier to reach left aligned. All that needs to be changed is the alignment tag on line 18: 

From: 
<tr><td valign=top align=center> 

To: 
<tr><td valign=top align=left>
fields.summary: Appearance of roadmap-panel.vm has changed between 2.6 and 3.0

fields.description:
Customer wants to have a comment for each issue in the "Release Notes".

The release notes are currently just a list of resolved issues (actually only the subject of the issues). If we could have a note for each issue, the release notes would be a much more useful document.

When resolving an issue, the developer usually enters a comment with important information about the fix.

If JIRA would display this particular comment in the release notes, it would be a useful and practical improvement that should not take too much effort. Maybe JIRA could display a checkbox to include/not include the comment into the release notes.
fields.summary: Add comment to Release Notes entry

fields.description:
I suspect there is a bug in the code that upgrades the DB from older releases of Jira to 3.03. To my recollection, I have updated twice up to 3.03 but I don't recall the exact details.

I have recently upgraded to MySQL 4.1.9 and I noticed this in my Tomcat logs the next time I restarted:

[core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] WARNING: Column "AUTHOR" of table "jiraaction" of entity "Action" has a column size of "85" in the database, but is defined to have a column size of "255" in the entity definition.
[...]

I get this warning for exactly 157 different columns in different tables. I tried updating them by hand but it's taking way too long.

When Jira finds such a mismatch, there should be a way for us to tell it to automatically update the DB to reflect the entity definition. Especially if the DB size is smaller than the entity definition, it should automatically update the DB since there is no risk of data loss.

I filed this as a bug instead of a RFE because the DB should have never gotten into this bad state in the first place...
fields.summary: Mismatch between entity definition and database

fields.description:
HI,

I have JIRA installed on my server, it always starts up on windows start and has the tomcat window running to allow JIRA to work. I want to use JIRA as a service and avoid getting a window comming up. 
Please do tell me how to use JIRA as a service and avoid losing the existing data on the machine. 

The following is the startup.bat file
@echo off
if "%OS%" == "Windows_NT" setlocal
rem ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
rem Start script for the CATALINA Server
rem
rem $Id: startup.bat,v 1.4 2002/01/15 02:55:38 patrickl Exp $
rem ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
rem Guess CATALINA_HOME if not defined
if not "%CATALINA_HOME%" == "" goto gotHome
set CATALINA_HOME=.
if exist "%CATALINA_HOME%\bin\catalina.bat" goto okHome
set CATALINA_HOME=..
:gotHome
if exist "%CATALINA_HOME%\bin\catalina.bat" goto okHome
echo The CATALINA_HOME environment variable is not defined correctly
echo This environment variable is needed to run this program
goto end
:okHome
set EXECUTABLE=%CATALINA_HOME%\bin\catalina.bat
rem Check that target executable exists
if exist "%EXECUTABLE%" goto okExec
echo Cannot find %EXECUTABLE%
echo This file is needed to run this program
goto end
:okExec
rem Get remaining unshifted command line arguments and save them in the
set CMD_LINE_ARGS=
:setArgs
if ""%1""=="""" goto doneSetArgs
set CMD_LINE_ARGS=%CMD_LINE_ARGS% %1
shift
goto setArgs
:doneSetArgs
call "%EXECUTABLE%" start %CMD_LINE_ARGS%
:end

I have JIRA installed on C:\app\atlassian-jira-enterprise-3.0.3-standalone\bin

Thanks
Roshan
fields.summary: Use JIRA as a service

fields.description:
When the work log is created, an option list is presented where I can specify who should be able to see the work log. If a user is not a member of the allowed group, he/she shall not get notifications and shall not be able to see the job log, even he/she is the createor of the issue. 

This works fine in the ´job log, but in the change history the timespent values are visible for other users and groups.

Unfortunately this makes us the job log function unusable, because we have to hide the details for user specific work log.
fields.summary: Problem with job log permissions and change log

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-5869].
  {panel}

When creating a sub-task, it automatically inherits the security 
level of its parent. Using the workaround described in JRA-5442, 
it is possible to change the security level of the sub-task, e.g.
to hide special tasks from your customers.

However, it is not possible to set the ("hidden") security level
upon creation of the sub-task. So, if you want to create a 
private sub-task, that is not accessible by your customers, you have 
to first create a sub-task that is automatically private, hence
generating an automatic eMail notification of your customer. Then, 
you have to edit the sub-task to change the security level.

Wouldn't it be more efficient to let the user choose the security level
when creating the sub-task?
Or could we have special security levels for different types of sub-tasks.
E.g. create a sub-task "private sub-task" that automatically relates to
a certain security level "private".

(Just to explain: We are using Jira Enterprise 3.0.3 to track new 
features. It is used by us and our clients. When a new feature issue is
created, we put several development/private sub-tasks under it, to
split work for one feature or to assign private work that has to
be done in order to build the new feature. But we do not want our
customer to see, what is going on "behind the scenes".)
fields.summary: Sub-Task should have independent security levels

If I add an attachment to an issue with a '"' in it, the list of attachment is no longer displayed in issue.

At attachment time, there is an error displayed (screenshot attached).  When user proceeds, the issue shows no attachments, but the list is there when clicking on "managed attachments", but clicking on the attachment with double-quotes in its name leads to a 404.
fields.summary: Attachment submitted with double-quotes characters in filename results in attachment not being listed in issue

fields.description:
The time tracking with task and sub-task could be enhanced.
For example, as soon as you enter a sub-task for a task, to original estimate of the parent issue may be the sum of all his sub-task. The display progress bar of a task could also be enhanced with that instead of a ratio of resolve/total sub-task. For example, a task advancement is 66% if 2 of 3 sub-tasks are resolved even if the third task is estimated to take 10 times the time others.
fields.summary: Task sub-task time tracking

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-5862].
  {panel}

It would be great to add the issue field advancement percentage for time tracking. This field could be updated in concert with the remaining estimate and time spent. For example, a task with 4 days of time spent and 6 days of remaining estimate may have an advancement percentage of 40% 
(time spent / (time spent + remaining estimate)). 
Also when logging work it may be used to adjust estimate. A developper could state that he's at 75% of advancement. For example,
Original estimate 4d
time spent: 2d (developper entry)
advancement %: 75% (developper entry)
With those entries, Jira could adjust the remaining time to 5.3 hours 
(time spent / advancement percentage - time spent)

I propose that because our administrator like % and for them it's easier to see the overall advancement with % instead of time.
fields.summary: Use advancement percentage in addition of the time remaining

fields.description:
We're using PopService to create issues automatically in JIRA. We also allow the reporting end users to be automatically created within JIRA.

The service is configured like this: 

Name: Support Create/Comment
com.atlassian.jira.service.services.pop.PopService 	
handler:	Create Or Comment Handler
popserver:	Support Mail
handler.params:	project=SUP, issuetype=8,
catchemail=support <at> <our company> <dot> com, createusers=true

The SUP project is defined like this: 

> > Key:  SUP
> > URL: No URL
> > Lead: Michael 
> > Default Assignee: Project Lead
> > Notification Scheme: Support Notification Scheme ( select scheme | edit notifications ) 
> > Permission Scheme: Support Permission Scheme ( select scheme | edit permissions ) 
> > CVS Modules: None ( select modules ) Mail Configuration: Mail notifications from this project will come 
> > from 'support  <at> <our company> <dot> com' ( edit configuration )

The problem is that SOMETIMES the issue are not assigned to our Project Lead (Michael) but to a (as it seems random) JIRA user. 

This "random JIRA user" seems to always be the same as the first user specified in a To: field of in the incoming email. The problem is that the To: field can origin from a quoted mail or from the mail thread of the inbound email!

For example see this inbound email creating a ticket which have incorrectly assigned to the end user Naseem.

> > "Hi Michael,
> > 
> > Can I ask why 1 and 2 would cause the ""customer's pc hangs on "The 
> > program is communicating with the server" issue?
> > 
> > Thanks,
> > 
> > Glenn
> > 
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: support
> > Sent: 26 January 2005 08:24
> > To: Naseem
> > Cc: Glenn;
> > Subject: Re: Error when sending messages [P3] [Ref.450757]
> > 
> > Hi Naseem,
> > ..."

As you can see it is the original message that has the To: field set to Naseem. And the automatic assignment can be completed as Naseem himself DOES HAVE a user account in JIRA (from earlier reports), but he should never be assigned any issues.

It seems that the PopService is looking for the first To: field it can find and tries to assign accordingly. If this fails it assigns to default assignee.

It's a cool feature if it can assign according to the To: field, but it should never be To: fields of quoted emails. It would also be good if this feature could be turned off, so that default assignee is always used. <-- Feature Request! :)

Also the To: field sometimes is replaced with a localized field ("Till:" in Swedish) and this could perhaps affect this problem. So it would be good if you could define what fields to detect!

I have actually ensured this already AND the PopService violates the permission scheme!!! Users - like Nassim below - was actually assigned to an issue eventhough he's only a "jira-user". We have set the "Assignable User" user permission to "jira-developers" group for all our permission schemes.

So it seems like a bug that the PopService by-pass the permission enforcement!
fields.summary: PopService automatic assignment skips permission checking

fields.description:
Regarding ergonomy of field layout scheme:
 Changing the field comments is quite a pain as well. Eg: I have some fields which are common through lot of issue layout. If I want to change all of them, then I have to click a lot.
Solutions I can imagine:
 1. the modify the edit to a grid with all comments show up in an editable text box
 2. have kind of a simple inharitance where a field layout can reference an ancestor and gets. This is more complex way if it's design and developed for sure but there are a lot of parts in system where it could used as well (eg. permission schemes).
fields.summary: Managing custom fields comments is not ergonomical

fields.description:
> We use a custom classloader with Jetty 5.0.  Probably because 
> of Jetty's dependence on commons logging, Jetty was confused 
> over Jira's inclusion of the same jar.  Also, since Jira uses 
> log4j to implement the logging, there was some classloading 
> confusion over where to find it.
> 
> To get Jira running, I removed the commons-logging jar from 
> Jira and placed log4j in jetty/ext/ (where commons-logging 
> already was).  Also, I symlinked the Postgres JDBC jar into 
> Jira's WEB-INF/lib directory.
> --
fields.summary: Jetty 5.0 class loading problems with commons-logging

fields.description:
Unfortunately - the best name comparator returns '0' if the full names are the same, even if the usernames are different.

We should fix this :)

A work around is to change the full name of one of the users (adding a space, or extra characters should work).
fields.summary: Statistics by assignee are wrong if there are two users with the same 'Full name'

fields.description: When commenting over an issue, many times commenter needs to check previous comments. In jira, it does not show previous comments n the new comment entry screen. this , IMHO is a very basic and important functionality needed in an issue tracking system.
fields.summary: show previous comments while commenting

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-5845].
  {panel}

When using multiple Issue Field Schemes with one having the Components field marked as hidden the list of Components is missing from the Open Issues section of the project browser and as a filter option.

To duplicate:
1. Create an Issue Field Scheme in Administration | Issue Fields | Field Layout Schemes
2. For one of the schemes mark the Components field as hidden
3. For a project make one of the issue types use the scheme edited in step 2
4. Go to that projects browse page and click on Open Issues
5. Go to the issue filter and select the project

Expected behavior:
At step 4 the components for the project should be listed on the left side of the table (next to the versions).

At step 5 filtering by component should be an option


Actual behavior:
At step 4 the left side of the table is blank

At step 5 filtering by component is not available


Modifying the scheme created in step 1 to make components visible for that scheme makes things work as expected.
fields.summary: Components missing from Filter / Open Issues browser

fields.description:
I realize that there is capabilities of selecting a group of people (by group name), but it would be really nice to provice a comma delimited list of usersnames to filter on (as these usernames are they are not in the same group)

Thanks!
fields.summary: allow multiple users when creating filters
Archiving Old Issues

fields.description:
The DESCRIPTOR field in table "jiraworkflows" is of type "TEXT" and is limited to 64k of XML. When the workflow definition exceeds 64k the workflow is corrupted. This lead to dataloss and complete loss of service.

Workaround: Edit the database and change field type to MEDIUMTEXT (16mb) or LONGTEXT (4gb).
fields.summary: Workflow definition limited to 64kb!

fields.description:
The "External references" is used to spam JIRA databases. I need a way to remove external references, or I have to turn this feature off.

Is there a blacklist for such spammers?
fields.summary: "External references" used for spam

fields.description:
AS reported by a number of clients - the workflow editing is very slow.

The performance problem is due to the fact that there are numerous checks to see if various workflow elements are active (i.e. associated with a project) or not.

The attached files include an implementation of a simple cache in order to store the active workflow elements - so as this process does not need to be carried out each time.

Replacing the original files with the files attached should resolve this problem.

On first vieweing the workflow elements or activating a new workflow, a delay will occur while the cache is re-populated. However, subsequent access should be faster.
fields.summary: Workflow editing performance is very slow.

fields.description:
We have people with different roles in different projects. 
Eg. X is a project leader in project A but he is developer in project B. 
For this scenario I set up groups for each project like this:
ProjectA_leaders
ProjectB_leaders
ProjectA_developers
ProjectB_developers

etc.

I assign people for the group corresponding the role in their project. 
The big drawback with this workaround is that I'm not able check group permission (roles) in workflows only if I create separete worklfow for each project.

An idea to solve it to have project roles schemes. This would allow me to assign peoples for groups in a scheme and assign this scheme to a project. 


Or is there better workaround than what I use?
fields.summary: Different user roles in different projects

fields.description:
The WorkflowCurrentStepCheck Integrity check uses the wrong variable type in the following line (71):

List currentSteps = genericDelegator.findByAnd("OSCurrentStep", UtilMisc.toMap("entryId", workflowEntryId.toString()));

The OSCurrentStep ID is an numeric value rather than a string. 

Must test that when changing this value, interegirty check still runs.
fields.summary: WorkflowCurrentStepCheck Integrity check using wrong variable type.

I am not sure if this is simply due to the pages not being cached sinced they have never been viewed or if it is simply slow. If it the latter then is there any way the speed of workflow management operations can be improved?

Thanks mucho!
fields.summary: Workflow Editor Performance

fields.description:
When, as an administrator, I set a users password, they are still unable to log in.  This seems to affect users who already have an account. Changing their password, or deleting them and readding them does not seem to work.

We are doing a demo of this product for department use, and I need folks to try it out and test it.  Them not being able to login does not help the process.

Need ideas as to why this is happening.

Thanks,
fields.summary: Users unable to  login

fields.description:
This may or may not be a bug:  One of my CVS Modules was accessing the wrong CVS Repository.  When I initially defined the CVS Module I plugged in a value for the ViewCVS URL.  However, I can't clear it out.  It points to the wrong CVS repository and the new CVS repository doesn't have ViewCVS installed/enabled.  So I changed the CVSROOT and password and tested the new repository information without incident.  I tried several times, though, to remove the URL in the ViewCVSURL field.

It does not harm having it in there.  The links generated on the Version Control tab, though, will not point to the correct files.  I'll just tell my users, for that specific project, don't click on the linked files.

--Mel
fields.summary: Can not clear ViewCVS URL...

After the Core-release the issues are rolled out over various projects respectively various project-versions, e.g. the rollout take place for Version A_15, B_13 and C_10 of the projects A,B and C. fields.description:
Hi.

Despite looking through the reasonably good documents on the site I cannot find anything that works well either as a user guide or administrator guide. I started writing these myself (rough drafts attached) but I think someone somewhere must have done the same thing!! I realise everyone's implementations are different but basic features such as issue linking, filtering, components driving assignees , etc. all work the same.

This is a time consuming task but it is necessary if I am to hand over this application to our support teams. Any help welcome.

Thanks, Scott.

For example, once a user has the permission to set a security level - but does not have any permissions to the actual security levels themselves - the issue will be created with the security level 'None', even if there is a default level specified.

Add ability to grant multiple groups permissions simultaneously
Email issue to external person

For instance, project a, b & c in permission scheme X can be linked to each other but cannot be linked to project d in permission scheme Y unless explicitly allowed by group association.

ie. I created a filter that's interesting for other

fields.description:
We work on a number of projects in-house, and run projects for clients as well. 

I set up a portal page for us and one for each client, with their projects under it by entering individual project portlets. 

This looks good initially, as our dashboard is also growing to "a half mile long" as another user comments. Dismayed to find out that this would have to be recreated and administered on every desktop. 

1. GLOBAL PORTALS Portals selectable as "global" vs individual. Adding a project to a global portal shows up automatically on every desktop. Portal permissions would let us easily expose a customized portal to a client or vendor.

2. CONFIGURABLE PROJECTS PORTLET Being able to select which projects appear on an instance of this portlet would be a big plus for portal usability. A CMS we are evaluating gives you a simple list of options which you multi-select using the shift and ctrl keys.

3. PROJECT GROUPING A way to group projects, which augments 1 and 2 above, so projects/portal pages can be linked to a business unit or other useful grouping. Just like issues have types, projects can have groups.
fields.summary: Global portals, configurable project portlet, project groups

fields.description:
After a couple of day Jira is slowing down and not responding to wed requests. The only way to get Jira to work again is by restarting the tomcat service that is running Jira. Is there a log file I can review or have someone review to help figure out what is causing Jira to have this problem?

Thanks
Dustin Baker

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-5794].
  {panel}

We have a company CVS repository, that covers all of our projects. It is organized in such a way:
- CVSROOT/
          - project1
          - project2
          -.....

In jira we have the same projects. So one way to go is creating CVS modules (in jira) to link both CVS and Jira projects. But that would unfortunately mean that a bug discovered in one project that was resolved in another (platform had a bug which customers of an app found) could not be linked. Is it possible to set up a global cvs module in jira? I was unable to get jira to accept an empty string for module in cvs.

I hope u see what I mean.

Hi ,
  We are facing problem while migrating from JIRA 2.6 to 3.0. 

Status of our Environment
1. Using MSSQL DB
2. We are having 121 Projects , Each project has more that 100 issues.

Problems Identified:
Thru XML backup we are not able to restore data. --( No specific error is found in catalina.out log)

Let us know the possible ways to migrate to JIRA 3.0 ASAP.

Waiting for your solutions.
Is that pointing the new JIRA 3 instance to the current DB will work with out any changes?

--Britto

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-5791].
  {panel}

Our Release management process would be enhanced by allowing more than Unreleased/Released as the status for a version.

For example, it would be very useful to have a release in state "Development", and then propagate it through "Integration Testing", "System Testing", "User Acceptance Testing" and finally into "Production". Another state, say "Retired" or "Deprecated" would be useful as well.

This needn't be a formal lifecycle/workflow kind of approach.

There is probably an overlap with the Version family ideas discussed in JRA-5316 and JRA-5680.
fields.summary: Workflow for Versions

fields.description:
I am trying to upgrade to 3.0.3 from 2.5.3.  However, I am not able to export the data in XML, it keeps complaining about invalid characters.

I am aware of your issue 2066 which is supposed to have fixed this matter.  I have run the fix_export JSP attached in that issue for v2.5 and the same problem persists.

I have also tried using unix 'tr' to trim away control characters except 9, 10 and 13 in tomcatdb.script (i am using hsql). I also tried resetting bit-7 of all characters so the file is pure ascii.  Still doesn't work.  

Please help.  I can send my tomcatdb.script separately on rquest.  Thanks!
fields.summary: Unable to export XML for upgrade to 3.0

fields.description:
Transitions for each workflow step are shown in the order they have been created in the workflow editor.

We have a very large workflow with many transitions per step. It would be nice if the transitions could be sorted so that the could be presented in a more "sequential" order. 

Of course i could create the workflow in the rigth order, byt the workflow is created as a copy of the JIRA workflow and therefore our transitions are shown after the Resolve and Close transitions wich looks a little bit strange.

Even if i created the workflow from scratch, it would not be possible to edit the order later.
fields.summary: Transition order should be sortable for each Step Name

fields.description:

For example in a cell displaying the number of critical issues for a particular project for a particular user, when I click on that number I get all critical issues for that project. I would expect to see only the issues that the number being shown reflects.

This should be for all hyperlinks shown in the table including priority, project and issue counts. Without this, the drill down capability is almost useless.
